channel.title: Comments on: Led Zeppelin reunion on again, maybe, off again, probably

item.title: By: Kevin Langston
item.dc:creator: Kevin Langston
item.description: <p>Billboard <a href="http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003637012" rel="nofollow">says </a> there's a press conference scheduled for next week that should "clear everything up."</p> <p>They also allude to Led Zeppelin's <a href="http://ledzeppelin.com/" rel="nofollow">site</a> where the date 11.13.2007 is posted. Maybe they're excited about the new Wu joint.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Billboard says there’s a press conference scheduled for next week that should “clear everything up.”

They also allude to Led Zeppelin’s site where the date 11.13.2007 is posted. Maybe they’re excited about the new Wu joint.

item.title: By: Eric Greenwood
item.dc:creator: Eric Greenwood
item.description: true. jones can still hold his own, probably better than any of them at this point. i also agree that led zeppelin ceased to exist the moment john bonham died. anything else could never even remotely be the same.
item.content:encoded: true. jones can still hold his own, probably better than any of them at this point. i also agree that led zeppelin ceased to exist the moment john bonham died. anything else could never even remotely be the same.

item.title: By: Kevin Langston
item.dc:creator: Kevin Langston
item.description:
All valid points, pops. But what gets me most is the sheer size of Robert Plant's head these days. I mean, it just keeps growing. It's huge. It's got its own weather system.
Oh, and where's the love for John Paul Jones? I bet if there's one cat who'd still be able to represent, it'd be him.
item.content:encoded:
All valid points, pops. But what gets me most is the sheer size of Robert Plant’s head these days. I mean, it just keeps growing. It’s huge. It’s got its own weather system.

Oh, and where’s the love for John Paul Jones? I bet if there’s one cat who’d still be able to represent, it’d be him.

item.title: By: bobby
item.dc:creator: bobby
item.description: Greatest rock band in history, bar none. Sadly, Led Zeppelin ceased to exist the second that John Bonham died in 1980. The unique Zep chemistry was possible only with those four musicians.
item.content:encoded: Greatest rock band in history, bar none. Sadly, Led Zeppelin ceased to exist the second that John Bonham died in 1980. The unique Zep chemistry was possible only with those four musicians.
